author: VashJuan
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

I just want powershell to auto-update (in VScode insiders) automatically without my 'managing it' with extra commands, clicks/diversions of workflow. I'm on win 10 insiders, all software is the latest available. 

Currently I have to go to Windows Update which says I'm up-to-date (last checked 5 minutes ago...), then back to aka.ms to actually get and install the minor update. WASTED TIME FOR ME. Is there some way to just say "auto-install" powershell updates as soon as they are available? I'm happy to tolerate any bugs, as I'm NOT a power user.

Thx.

### Expected behavior

```console
NO time out of my work flow.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
About 4 minutes of (not so agonizing) clicking
```


### Environment data

```powershell
PS C:\Projects\rangertrak> $PSVersionTable
```

comments.body: [Updates through windows update takes 1-2 weeks after we release.  ](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/install/microsoft-update-faq?view=powershell-7.2#how-soon-after-release-are-updates-advertised-by-microsoft-update)

comments.body: there is an issue about the timing of the message already filed here:  https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/17369

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: The package from the Windows Store is more automatic.  There are some known issues with it, but they are corner cases, and we are working with Windows to resolve those issues.
